name: Finland Chamber of Commerce (Keskuskauppakamari)
membership: Finland Chamber of Commerce is a member of Eurochambres. Eurochambres is a co-operation body and network of European Chambers of Commerce and Industry.
memberOrga: 19 regional chambers of commerce in Finland.
goal:
Finland Chamber of Commerce promotes entrepreneurship and a favourable business environment in Finland and coordinates the operations of the nineteen independent regional Chambers of Commerce in Finland. The 19 Finnish Chambers of Commerce have approximately 20,000 member companies.
Finland Chamber of Commerce ensures self-regulation in business; offers services related to, for example, dispute resolution, goods inspection and property valuation, and awards Medals of Merit.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Communication, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Customs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Home Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Regional Policy, Research and Technology, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: Company law, securities market regulation, corporate governance, gender quotas, collective redress, consumer protection, IPR, digitalisation.
